intro: Cupaniopsis glabra, commonly known as the smooth cupaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, glabrous bark. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and usually have a glossy appearance. Cupaniopsis glabra is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its natural habitat.
